feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: She gave such a gape that Aunt March asked her what she meant by opening her mouth wide enough to take the whole book in at once.

feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: Mr. Laurence hooked up a big fish with the crooked end of his cane and held it out to a poor woman, who was so glad and surprised that she took it right in her arms and thanked him over and over.

causedBy.name: Mr. Laurence giving a fish to a poor woman

feels.name: Gratitude
feels.quote: The poor woman was so glad and surprised, she took the fish right in her arms and thanked him over and over.

causedBy.name: Mr. Laurence giving a fish to a poor woman

feels.name: Anxiety
feels.quote: As I sat cutting out blue flannel jackets to-day, I felt very anxious about father, and thought how lonely and helpless we should be if anything happened to him.

feels.name: Contentment
feels.quote: Beth decided to try the old woman's advice and was surprised to see how well off they were.

feels.name: Moral Satisfaction
feels.quote: Amy went on with her work in the proud consciousness of virtue and the successful utterance of two long words in a breath.

Events.name: Mr. Laurence giving a fish to a poor woman
